image.altText: Penny Wong looks towards the camera with a serious stare.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the speech US President Donald Trump delivered at the UN is simply more of the same from him and "consistent" with his views and actions since being elected for a second term.

title.children: 'Consistent': Trump's rambling UN speech no surprise to Wong

image.altText: An extreme close-up of Donald Trump's face, looking solemn as he listens to someone off camera.

props.synopsis: If Donald Trump actually means what he has just said — that NATO countries have a right to shoot down any Russian jets in their airspace — the US president may be contracting out a serious counteroffensive against Russian aggression to NATO countries.

title.children: Trump's comments on 'shooting down' jets hints at a change behind the scenes

image.altText: A man looks at his watch as fluid runs down a tube into his belly.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians who were injured by COVID vaccines say they are facing a 'cruel and complex' system to get compensation from the government.

title.children: 'No end in sight' for Australia's COVID vaccine injury victims

image.altText: blue Optus signage outside an office on Lyonmark Road

props.synopsis: In enforcing the fine today, the Federal Court's Justice Patrick O'Sullivan described the company's conduct as "extremely serious" and "appalling".

title.children: Optus to pay $100m fine as crisis engulfing the telco continues

image.altText: A man gestures in front of a painted skyscape.

props.synopsis: Despite the late-night host's return, several US ABC affiliates did not air the episode, excluding an estimated one-quarter of American households.

title.children: Jimmy Kimmel returns, says he never meant to 'make light' of Charlie Kirk's murder

image.altText: errol musk an older man looks out from behind a pane of glass

props.synopsis: Multiple police reports, social workers and family members uncover the allegations against 79-year-old Errol Musk.

title.children: The background on child abuse allegations tearing the Musk family apart

image.altText: A close up of a stern Donald and slightly smiling Melania Trump while standing on an escalator.

props.synopsis: Footage of the US president and his wife's reactions to the mishap was shared widely on social media.

title.children: UN says Trump videographer likely triggered viral escalator moment

image.altText: Antoinette Lattouf in a black silk dress, on a CBD street, with four people walking behind here.

props.synopsis: The judge ordered ABC to pay a fine of $150,000 for unlawfully sacking journalist and presenter Antoinette Lattouf for reasons including her political opinions.

title.children: Judge says ABC 'let down the Australian public' over Lattouf sacking

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference

props.synopsis: Western Australia's GST deal, expected to cost the Commonwealth $60 billion by 2029, will form part of a review by the Australian Productivity Commission.

title.children: Review to assess whether WA's $60 billion GST slice is fair

image.altText: A black Tesla car drives down a wide city road. No driver sits behind the steering wheel

props.synopsis: Owners of late model Teslas can now access the company's self-driving technology. But the rules for how drivers can use it differ around the country.

title.children: Tesla's self-driving technology has landed in Australia. What are the rules?

image.altText: A composite image of Clayton Lewis and Kearyn Baccus arriving at court

props.synopsis: Both players were paid $10,000 each to intentionally get themselves yellow cards while playing for Macarthur FC against Sydney FC to influence overseas bets on the game.

title.children: Former A-League footballers sentenced over betting scam

image.altText: camille takes a selfie with green landscape in the background

props.synopsis: Camille says being made redundant was hard, so she began sharing her experiences on TikTok hoping to help others.

title.children: 'Veiled in secrecy': Busting the stigma of redundancy by sharing online

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of Herbert Vere Evatt, taken in close-up, he is smiling and holding a pencil in the air

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese formally recognised Palestinian statehood on the world stage this week, but about 78 years ago a lesser-known Australian was fighting for the creation of a Jewish state.

title.children: The Australian 'domestic failure' who was key in the Israel-Palestine partition

image.altText: Bruce walks outside, flanked by others, wearing a blue suit, white shirt and pink tie and glasses.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann launches Federal Court action seeking funding for legal representation at a National Anti-Corruption Commission hearing after raids on his home in June last year.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann seeks funds for legal representation over 2024 raids

image.altText: matt dun with his daughter josephine, with her wearing a bow in her hair smiling at camera and wearing a football jersey

props.synopsis: A professor who lost his daughter to brain cancer in 2018 is hopeful the research to find a cure in children is just five years away from clinical trials.

title.children: Doctor who lost daughter to brain cancer hopeful for cure after $18m grant

image.altText: A 23-year-old man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: An Australian family is asking why Indonesian police allowed three Australian witnesses to return home without being interviewed after their 23-year-old son died on the Indonesian holiday resort island.

title.children: Australian family suspects foul play in son's death in Bali villa pool

image.altText: A freeze frame of a football replay on an old style TV

props.synopsis: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

title.children: The premiership team that won it all and was banned after one perfect season

image.altText: A photo of the brownlow medal

props.synopsis: Voting for the Brownlow Medal has been a hot topic again in the wake of Monday night's count, with the AFL open to letting umpires have access to statistics.

title.children: AFL boss hints at Brownlow change after voting controversy

image.altText: Mal Lanyon and Chris Minns

props.synopsis: For newly-announced Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon, Wednesday morning would have been both one of his proudest moments, and his most uncomfortable.

title.children: Premier knows he's taking a risk with new police commissioner

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: New data reveals that around 3 million Australians are engaged in some form of harmful gambling, which is linked to financial stress, family violence and poor mental health.

title.children: Gambling participation and harm on the rise in Australia, study reveals

image.altText: Sam Bailey and his wife Jenny sit on a quad bike with their kelpie in a paddock

props.synopsis: A "true blue" farmer, pilot, and pioneer for accessibility in agriculture has been honoured after his sudden death.

title.children: Quadriplegic farmer and pilot remembered as 'exceptional'

image.altText: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr speaking at a podium with President Donald Trump standing behind him.

props.synopsis: The US government has announced a drug named leucovorin will be approved to treat symptoms of autism in some children. So what is the drug, and is there any evidence to support its use?

title.children: What is leucovorin, the drug Trump claims can help treat autism?

image.altText: A photo of a man with short brown hair.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors have flagged more potential charges for the Victorian kindergarten cleaner accused of secretly filming children in a bathroom.

title.children: Another alleged victim found in kindergarten cleaner hidden camera case

image.altText: Katrina Powell speaks at a podium

props.synopsis: Hockeyroos great Katrina Powell has quit as coach of Australia's women's team after rebuilding a criticised culture in the elite program.

title.children: Hockeyroos coach Katrina Powell steps down

image.altText: A sign pointing to Kalgoorlie from Coolgardie.

props.synopsis: More than 15,000 homes and businesses were without electricity after the entire town of Kalgoorlie-Boulder lost power.

title.children: Massive power blackout shuts down Kalgoorlie-Boulder again

image.altText: The entrance to Elvis Presley's Graceland mansion

props.synopsis: A woman's attempt to sell off one of the most storied pieces of real estate in the US has come to naught. Here's how it happened.

title.children: Missouri woman jailed for trying to sell off Elvis Presley's estate

image.altText: water envelops a bench.

props.synopsis: The storm, which is the most powerful so far in 2025, is now heading towards the Chinese mainland, prompting widespread disruption and warnings of sea surges.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa lashes Taiwan, with 14 dead and 124 missing

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: A judge says the process of a bid to stop a criminal rape case against former Liberal Party staffer Bruce Lehrmann proceeding has been "problematic" after his lawyer missed a key deadline.

title.children: Court hears Bruce Lerhmann's lawyer 'not organised' as rape case delayed

image.altText: Lots of hands reaching for the footy against a black background.

props.synopsis: Ahead of the AFL grand final, national violence prevention organisation Our Watch is calling for the sporting community to address the increased risk of violence facing women during football finals.

title.children: Domestic violence services brace for spike on AFL grand final weekend

image.altText: Kevin Clark as drummer Freddy 'Spazzy McGee' Jones confronts his teacher played by Jack Black in School of Rock.

props.synopsis: On-screen portrayals of music teachers like School Of Rock are full of cliches. Researchers say this might be stopping more Australians from taking up the profession.

title.children: What films like Mr. Holland's Opus and School Of Rock get wrong about music teachers

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men standing in front of a camera in the bush, one man pointing to the side.

props.synopsis: Graham White was a pioneer of Australian radio and television and played a key role in the creation of numerous television series, including A Big Country.

title.children: Man behind iconic ABC TV programs dies aged 93

image.altText: Camp Mystic (2)

props.synopsis: Camp Mystic also announces plans for a memorial dedicated to "the lives of the campers and counsellors lost on July 4th".

title.children: Camp where 27 people died in floods to reopen next year for centenary

image.altText: Josh Dunkley of the Lions attempting to catch a ball from a Cats player.

props.synopsis: Wondering what time the AFL grand final starts and how you can watch it live? We've got you covered.

title.children: Ultimate guide to the 2025 AFL grand final decider between Geelong and Brisbane
